The claim made by Donald Trump that: illegal immigration costs our country more than $113 billion a year" was presented in a speech in Arizona.
The source of the: 113 billion figure was cited as a 2013 report from the Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR), a group seeking reduced immigration.
The FAIR report states that: 113 billion represents the total cost at the federal, state, and local levels for undocumented immigrants, with the majority of $84 billion being paid by state and local governments.
The American Immigration Council: a pro-immigrant think tank, criticized the previous FAIR report in 2010, stating that it relied on flawed assumptions and lacked empirical evidence to support its cost estimates.
